title: ST Full-time Report: Jeralyn Tan wins landmark Paralympic silver | More Singaporeans hooked on Hyrox
title_page: ST Full-time Report: Jeralyn Tan wins landmark Paralympic silver | More Singaporeans hooked on Hyrox | The Straits Times
maintext:
Welcome to the latest edition of ST Full-time Report, where the best sports content from The Straits Times is delivered to your inbox every Monday evening. Subscribe here for the weekly updates.
Dear ST reader,
Singapore athletes are making history at the Paris Paralympics with Jeralyn Tan winning a landmark boccia silver to add to the two swimming gold medals from the indomitable Yip Pin Xiu, who is making her fifth Games appearance.
In football, Briton Perry Ng and Japanese Kyoga Nakamura are training with the Singapore Lions as part of the move to naturalise the duo in the future.
Meanwhile, the Hyrox craze is gaining in popularity as over 6,000 turned out for the latest race, which was expanded to a two-day affair.
